rComments: The way he accomodated his teaching methods when everything went online says it all! This prof showed very remarkable efforts to make us understand and participate. Great prof, very nice, very caring, but expect hard tests :P !

Professor James McDonald is very caring and understanding of students needs and difficulties, however, that doesn't necessarily mean that he will just make it easy for you. If you have an issue, be clear and be reasonable, making it easier for him to accommodate you. A lot of quizzes and assignments. Lectures are loaded, so make sure you attend.

This is one prof who made online learning a blast. Lectures were super engaging, he explained the course material extremely well and genuinely cares about student's learning. His tests can be a little tricky but they're never too different from past finals/midterms (which he posts a lot of for practice).

Good prof and solid lecturer. His homework and exams are usually pretty hard because he always slips new types of questions in there, so you really need to understand what's going on to solve them perfectly.

He's a great lecturer, and really makes sure you understand the laws he derives. His CFD course is like MCG 3340 but without the hard exams. Assignments are tough but fair. He has high expectations but if you're willing to put in the work you'll do great. His anecdotes and jokes are also ��.

Every fluids textbook is wrong, his ways are only right. Math derivations of equations are what lessons are mostly consist of and he's condescending. His midterms always were such a challenge, with 2/3 questions that we're ridiculously difficult.

He definitely is a great guy. He is helpful and easy to approach. You must understand the materials in this course not memorizing them. Midterms and finals are not easy, they always come with one question trick you because this course is considered as one of the hardest 3000 level MCG course.

I'm just finishing up fluids with him this semester and I'm assuming all the negative posts are by people who didn't put in enough effort. I'm not a great student but I tried to have a good understanding of the material we were doing and not just memorize the homework. Have an A- average between the two midterms because of that.

MacDonald is a good teacher, but he's an ass when it comes to his midterms. I feel like I've learned a lot, but what he asks on the midterms is in such contrast to what you've been practicing that there's no way it'll all go well. He'll curves the grades however, so you'll get a 70 instead of a 60, but I would rather have a fair test to begin with
There are easy homeworks every week but when the midterms come they are ridiculously hard for no reason and you just pray you passed because he will not bell curve.

I hope you're reading this. Nice guy, but midterms are unnecessarily difficult; especially because the guy DOES NOT teach fluids in class, but rather spends pointless hours showing how calculus is used to get equations/laws.

Dr. McDonald is an awesome professor. I'm taking his CFD course right now, and I'm learning a ton. I had him for fluids I as well and thought he was great. Everyone on here complaining that his tests are "too hard," should drop out of engineering. Sure he has high expectations, but that forces you to actually learn...
Great teacher but difficult class. Although the prof is quite good at getting the content across, he makes his testing material more difficult than necessary. The labs are free marks.
Good lectures. Nice as a professor and knows everything in Fluid Mechanics. However, the midterm and finally was unnecessarily hard.

He is a really good professor and explains the application of calculus on a fluids problem really well. However he doesn't necessarily explain the physical intuition of fluids that well. Midterms and finals can be tough so be careful

Very good teacher, great lectures. But then come the midterms and final which are just ridiculously hard for no reason. Assignments are really hard too. Make sure you do good on the labs, could be the difference between passing and failing. Worst mark I've ever gotten.

Had McDonald for Fluid Mechanics I; VERY high expectations. Avg. for first midterm was 40-50%, then regrets giving an easy second midterm (avg. 70-80%) so he gives a brutally hard final. He's late for office hours by a few hours and doesn't give notice. He doesn't budge to give you petty marks. He'll claim hard marking was fair, if not, generous.

Nice guy but has very high expectations of students. He seems like one of those teachers that makes the midterms really hard so that you panic but then the final isn't too bad and you can salvage your grade.
